Auditorium Theater (Chicago, Ill.)
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Adler and Sullivan (American architectural firm, 1883-1924) [work]
Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Stage and proscenium arch from balcony

... one of the best-known designs of Louis Sullivan and Dankmar Adler. Completed in 1889, the building is located at the northwest corner of South Michigan Avenue and Congress Street (now Ida B. Wells Drive). The building was designed to be a multi-use complex, including offices, a theater, and a hotel. Since 1947, the Auditorium Building has been part of Roosevelt University. -- https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Auditorium_Building_(Chicago) [work]
